Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

51.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
51.str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

51.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
51.str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
And, even, also, namely.

51.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
51.str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
